  • Description: Liquid valve and the A end vapor valve were found to be leaking. Valves were in open position and plugs less than tool tight. Liquid valve had insufficient Teflon tape to secure plug properly. Valves were closed and the liquid plug was re-taped. Both plugs tightened.

PACKAGE DISCOVERED IN THE UNLOAD OFF TRAILER 570098 FROM 182-LEHI. DescribePack: NA DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: NA

item.title: Report X-2024031015
item.description:
Report X-2024031015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: PALATINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GOT A LEAKING PACKAGE FROM BAY 23 IN THE NORTHEAST PRIMARY. RESPONDER RETURNED THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO THE DMP. IN THE DMP, OPENED THE BOX TO BEGIN WORKING ON THE LEAKING TO DISCOVER THE PRODUCT WITH A CORROSIVE DIAMOND LABEL ON IT. IMMEDIATELY STOPPED, AND NOTIFIED RMP, WHO IN TURN NOTIFIED THE CHSP. AFTER CALLING THE UNDECLARED HOTLINE, GOT PERMISSION TO PROCESS THE CORROSIVE MATERIAL. THE OUTSIDE CARTON HAD NO HAZMAT INDICATIONS ON IT. THE INTERIOR OF THE CARTON THE HAZMAT WAS IN A CLEAR PLASTIC BAG WITH ANOTHER ITEM, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, N.O.S. THERE WAS ONLY THREE AIR BAGS OF PACKING MATERIAL IN THE BOX AS WELL.

item.title: Report X-2024030923
item.description:
Report X-2024030923

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET. UPON INSPECTION, INNER PAIL HAD BEEN SEVERELY DENTED NEAR TOP AND HAD LEAKED FROM LID. OUTER BOX ONLY HAD A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND, AND NO HAZMAT PAPERWORK, BUT PRODUCT IS A FULLY-REGULATED FLAMMABLE IN THIS AMOUNT. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED. DescribePack: INNER PAIL WAS SEVERELY DENTED NEAR TOP AND LEAKED FROM LID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

item.title: Report E-2024030436
item.description:
Report E-2024030436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN3085 Kolene No. 5 release from a 500-pound supersack. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 pounds of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the wooden trailer floor and a 15’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor. The supersack was ripped due to improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged sack into a 55-gallon poly drum for shipment on. All released product was placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged sack and pads were placed into a third 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024030437
item.description:
Report E-2024030437

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 14, 2024, approximately twenty (20) gallons of resin solution from a release at the previous terminal remained in the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the resin solution-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading tralier 572543 from SCHG the package was discovered damaged/wet. THe package was put in a tote and taken to the haz mat cage for processing. DescribePack: Upon inspection there was no damage to the outer package such as puncture marks, holes, etc. THe lid on one of the gallon jugs was loose and had leaked about 3-4 ounces onto the paper inside of the package and a little on the outer package. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Pakage was placed in a tote and taken to the haz mat cage to be processed. There was no visible spill in the trailer.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading 953397 from SCHG around 1am this package was discovered with a wet corner. The package was put in a tote and taken to the haz mat cage for processing. DescribePack: There was no external damage to the outer packaging such as hole or crushed. The lid on the inner bottle was half way open and nothing keeping it from staying closed during transit. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: There was no spill aside from what was on the package and it was taken to the haz mat caged and processed.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in belly of a trailer during Preload shift. It was upside down. Manager removed from trailer, placed into lined damage tote. All other leaked on items kept with package and placed in hazmat bags lined totes and moved to hazmat processing cage. PPE also kept with original package. DescribePack: Leaked from top of container, no other visible damage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediately removed from area and placed in hazmat cage.

item.title: Report I-2024020040
item.description:
Report I-2024020040

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CAO, UN3480 Lithium-Ion Batteries were discovered after acceptance in ORD Cargo. AWB# 81130862 - 3 pcs, Description: Exhibition Goods, booked as general commodity, no dangerous goods Originally the shipment was booked: ORD-JFK/M8950-02 Feb, JFK-LHR/M100-03 Feb. Later re-booked on a direct ORD-LHR flight 86/02 Feb. When moving the cargo from truck to build up area the plastic shrink wrap on one of the skids has loosened and agent noticed the labels. Shipment was stopped in ORD and placed in the Hold area.

  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: American Airlines Cargo
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ORD received an Undeclared Lithium-Ion battery shipment off Inbound RDU-ORD Hub truck #8620, 02/03/24. One of the skids (cardboard fully covered w/shrinkwrap) fell apart while offloading the truck revealing the Lithium Battery label as pictured below. Freight was booked as AMS-LHR, then LHR-RDU and RDU-ORD on truck. Shipping paper did not include required Lithium-ion batteries statement. There are no labels outside identifying that the shipment contains Lithium batteries. Shipment was placed in the Hold area.
